title: Stuck in Bronze
body:
I'm stuck in Bronze and I'm not sure why? 
Some games slipped away during the placement games, but I still dominated for the most part and was expecting to start climbing from silver.
The level in Bronze is quite bad, I do well against players in higher ranks yet get put in Bronze? How does this MMR system work?

Feel free to have a look at my match history and pick me apart I'm open to criticism.

replies.body: The reason your stuck in bronze is because your bad. Im not trying to be mean its the honest truth. and if you cannot accept that then your not ready to achieve higher then bronze.
I do think I am bad but still not bad enough to be put in Bronze! It is not challenging at all and I usually beat Bronze/Silver players, not talking rubbish it's a fact!
Lol if you were better then you would be out by now

http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=konquest236

1. Stop playing Lux. You suck at Lux. Your cs on her is awful. You seriously don't get her W until level 13... wow. 
If you want to keep playing her, learn to cs better and learn a proper skill order to maximise her potential.

2. Upgrade your trinket. its free at lvl 9. just do it.

3. play more and play often. the only way to get better is to play more and learn from mistakes. Stop thinking your only in Bronze because of teammates and "you do well against higher ranked people".

4. Play more! Your account has almost no ranked games over 3 years. My rough rule is, you can tell where someone deserves to be after 50 ranked games and they usually are where they belong after 100.

Yeah that is true, I don't know why I'm getting my w so late on her never used to! Will fix that. What is a good amount of cs to get with her?

The thing is I try not to get tilted about teammates and just play the game, but it is hard to carry every game  when people don't listen to simple instructions. When I say "I do well against players in higher ranks" that's because people are more competent and actually listen in those games lol 

I've seen people play much worse yet get placed in silver even with a low amount of wins, it is really just confusing to me! 

Sorry if I'm whinging but the game is just much more enjoyable playing with better players.

> [{quoted}](name=konquest236,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=jNGimeBb,comment-id=00050001,timestamp=2018-02-21T13:11:21.469+0000)
>
> What is a good amount of cs to get with her?

You see right there is your level of understanding. Ask yourself, "Why do we bother to cs?" and when you truly understand this question, then you will have your answer to the above question :)

> The thing is I try not to get tilted about teammates and just play the game, but it is hard to carry every game  when people don't listen to simple instructions. When I say "I do well against players in higher ranks" that's because people are more competent and actually listen in those games lol 

In soloqueue assume that they will not listen, and adjust your strategy accordingly.

> I've seen people play much worse yet get placed in silver even with a low amount of wins, it is really just confusing to me! 

There are many facets to the game. When it comes to playing worse, "worse" can just mean "worse" in one area only.

> Sorry if I'm whinging but the game is just much more enjoyable playing with better players.

Agreed. When you get to Diamond 2+, that's when the real game begins. Until then you will have to carry the trash on your back, sorry about that :)

[Here is an example of "carrying trash"](https://imgur.com/a/7LCmx). In this game it was a Co-op vs AI (Intermediate bots) game. However, all 4 of my teammates were cheating by using robots to level their accounts in this. I.E. they don't care if they win or lose, they just farm XP, so that the owner of the account can then sell it.
So they are feeding like crazy. But still got carried.
If you can go into a custom game and put yourself on a team of 4 bots (beginner) + yourself v 5 bots (intermediate) and win, then you are closer to learning how to carry. After that reduce the number of bots on your team until there is only yourself left. It's good training.

> [{quoted}](name=BarryButcher,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=jNGimeBb,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-02-21T08:26:25.524+0000)
>My rough rule is, you can tell where someone deserves to be after 50 ranked games and they usually are where they belong after 100.

Although a good rule of thumb, not a hard and fast rule. I think everyone has an upper limit that they will never pass. But I think many people are stuck well below their upper limit because they just dont know the game.

I dont reckon I'll ever get gold because I am not good enough in a 1v1 against a gold opponent - just dont have the micro skills. But I can lose lane and carry game in silver because I can make up for a lack of micro skills with some learned macro - I dont tilt too easily, I ward a bit, I pay attention to build order and itemisation, and I keep an eye on minimap. These are techniques that can be learned to maximise natural potential. 

So while he (assuming he because of the 'Kon' in konquest) might be stuck after 100 games, if he starts warding more in game 101 he'll start to climb. If he tilts less from game 110 on he'll climb. if he chooses the best build order to maximise impact on the game from game 120, he'll climb. If he doesnt push out and wards and keeps an eye on minimap, he'll climb.

Everyone has a potential to be reached and a ceiling they'll never pass. But learning the game allows you to get to that ceiling. Bronze is a low ceiling - if I can get out, anyone can.

> [{quoted}](name=konquest236,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=jNGimeBb,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-02-21T02:27:42.245+0000)
>
> I'm stuck in Bronze and I'm not sure why?

Because you've only played 11 games of ranked soloqueue. If you want to prove yourself, you need a much larger sample size. 

> Some games slipped away during the placement games, but I still dominated for the most part and was expecting to start climbing from silver.

Dominating means nothing, only winning. I would set your sights on improving at the game and not worrying about your rank. When you improve, then results get better.

> The level in Bronze is quite bad, I do well against players in higher ranks yet get put in Bronze? How does this MMR system work?

You'll have to earn the right to play players in higher ranks by overcoming bronze players firstly. If you can maintain a 50% win rate or better, you will eventually climb. But you'll need to grind out a lot of games.

> Feel free to have a look at my match history and pick me apart I'm open to criticism.

Keep playing twitch, and don't play mid lane until you know how your champion can cs, and also you know when and **when not** to roam.

Thanks for the reply! 
Really informative!

I do understand that I need to grind out a lot of games to achieve desired rank but I'm just curious to how this placement system works. Say I played with someone for the 10 placement games and got the same amount of wins, yet get placed in completely different divisions. How does that work?

It depends on what their mmr is, what the average opposition of the enemy's mmr is, and the score you got.

Also, its better to not duo when you are looking to improve and gain rank. Duo-ing puts you at a deficit (your three teammates will be weaker than the corresponding enemies), unless you both are way better than the division you are playing in.
I got out of bronze 2 to S4 in about 4 days. I'm stuck in silver because I am silver level.
Nice!! That's a really good effort

Stuck bronze, probably because you're bronze and have 0 objective control, dominating doesn't mean shit in ranked, winning does, learn how to carry and how to 1v9, then and only then will your ability to climb start, also 11 games is nothing, so play more then we can criticise you more, get your farm and kda up on the side, and keep your deaths low
